usefulItems: 1 large ramekin (8 cm) or 2 smaller ramekins, sealable jar or bottle, fine mesh sieve, ceramic or glass bowl
title: Chicken and port pâté

ingredients.content: 1 eschalot, peeled and cut into halves
1 bacon rasher (approx. 40 g), rind removed and cut into pieces
100 g chicken livers, washed and patted dry
1 lemon, zest only, no white pith
1 spring onion/shallot, trimmed and cut into halves

preparations.content: Place eschalot into mixing bowl and chop <b>3 sec/speed 7<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add bacon rasher, butter, dried thyme, ground allspice and port and sauté <b>4 min/100°C/speed 1<b>, placing simmering basket instead of measuring cup onto mixing bowl lid.
Add chicken livers, sea salt and ground pepper and chop <b>5 sec/speed 6<b>.
Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula then cook <b>2 min/100°C/speed 1<b>.
Add double cream and ground ginger and blend <b>15 sec/speed 9<b>. Pour into a large ramekin (8 cm) or 2 smaller ramekins and place into refrigerator to set for 30 minutes. Clean and dry mixing bowl.
Place lemon zest into mixing bowl and grate <b>10 sec/speed 8<b>.
Scrape down sides of mixing bowl then repeat grating <b>10 sec/speed 8<b> until a fine consistency is achieved.

Add all remaining ingredients and cook <b>30 min/Varoma//speed 2<b>, placing simmering basket instead of measuring cup onto mixing bowl lid. Strain through a fine mesh sieve into a hot-rinsed sealable jar or bottle and set aside to cool until ready use. Clean and dry mixing bowl.
Once pâté has set, place gelatine leaf into a ceramic or glass bowl and cover with ice cold water for 5 minutes or until soft and swollen.
Place port and cooled white balsamic reduction into mixing bowl and cook <b>2 min 30 sec/Varoma/speed 2<b>, placing simmering basket instead of measuring cup onto mixing bowl lid.
Squeeze water out of gelatine, then add gelatine to mixing bowl and combine 10 sec/speed 1 or until gelatine dissolves. Allow jelly mixture to cool .
Gently pour cooled jelly over pâté and return to the refrigerator for 30 minutes, or until jelly has set, before serving.

hintsAndTricks: You can substitute 8 white peppercorns with 8 black peppercorns.
No cheese platter is ever complete without homemade pâté. The port jelly provides a pleasantly sweet contrast to the rich flavour of the pâté.
Use leftover port to make the port sauce in Lamb rack with port sauce and parnsip purée.
Freeze remaining chicken livers in 100 g portions for future use.
Store remaining White balsamic reduction in a cool dark place to use in other recipes.
